intro: Neuracanthus africanus var. ruahae, commonly known as the African starfish plant, is a rare and striking species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a compact rosette structure with thick, waxy leaves that store water, aiding in survival during dry periods. It produces vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
